In the Assemblée Nationale, the rise of 'TikTok speeches' sparks debate
subhead: Many French MPs now post their speeches from the chamber on social media, leading to a more scripted speaking style. Some within the Assemblée see the practice as grating, others as undermining the legislature's work.

Trump breaks down plan for Putin in Alaska, a 'feel-out meeting'
subhead: Asked about inviting Volodymyr Zelensky to Alaska for the meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday, Trump suggested the Ukrainian president would be involved in talks at a future date.

headline: The Grand Canyon has been ravaged by wildfires for over a month
subhead: With nearly 55,000 hectares already burned, the 'Dragon Bravo Fire' is the largest of around 40 wildfires that are currently active in the United States.

headline: Taylor Swift announces 12th album 'The Life of a Showgirl' for 'pre pre-order'
subhead: This is the follow-up to Swift's last studio album, 'The Tortured Poets Department,' which was released last year and sold 1.4 million copies the first day.  A disclaimer on her site notes that the album's release date has not yet been announced, and but that it will ship before October 13.

headline: The remarkable and unforgettable images of painter Ithell Colquhoun, on display in London
subhead: Tate Britain is dedicating a major retrospective to the British surrealist, who has been unjustly overlooked for far too long. Her work is a revelation.

For young underground partiers, Paris is 'a playground in motion'
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (5/6). In Paris and its outskirts, clandestine parties are held in discreet locations, gathering a generation of techno fans far removed from established clubs.

headline: More and more Ethiopians are risking their lives at sea in attempts to reach Yemen
subhead: On August 3, at least 90 migrants died when their boat sank in the Gulf of Aden. All of them hailed from Ethiopia's Tigray region, which has been plagued by ongoing political instability after two years of civil war.

headline: When partying and protest go hand in hand: 'Celebrating together re-energizes activists'
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (4/6). Collectives and artists are working to put festivities at the heart of their activism. It is a way to fight activist fatigue, attract young people to their causes and escape repression.
